So we have customers typically
going through three phases.
First, rehost,

moving infrastructure
from on-premises to AWS.

And we often refer to
this as lift and shift
because there is no need for code changes

as you are simply migrating
existing applications
and databases to cloud instances.
- That sounds nice and simple.
So how might a customer actually go about

performing a simple lift
and shift or a rehost?
- Yeah, so the easiest way to do this,

and one used very often by
our customers such as 3M,

is to use AWS application
migration servers, MGN.
MGN copies your servers to AWS

by setting up a replication
server in your AWS account.
You install an agent which takes snapshots
of the original server

and sends those copies
to AWS server bit by bit.

This copies everything
over without slowing down
or stopping your original server.
Once all the data is copied over,
MGN can launch the AWS copy of the server
whenever you're ready.

MGN can also perform
agentless snapshot replication
from a vCenter source environment.
- Yep, yeah, so MGN is extremely awesome
and it's easy to use.
Are there any other ways

that we help customers

and cloud environments,

reduce the required number

and enhance resource efficiency,
